headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body:
### üí° Codex Review https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/blob/5ebc129a35ac1e0cafe4e06a9dd11c7dd9823d5f/src/agents/memory/openai_responses_compaction_session.py#L229-L234 **![P2 Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/P2-yellow?style=flat) Include compaction_mode in deferred decision context** When a turn includes local tool outputs, `AgentRunner` triggers `_defer_compaction`, which calls `should_trigger_compaction` without `compaction_mode`. Since `run_compaction` now supplies `compaction_mode` in the context, custom hooks that rely on `context["compaction_mode"]` will raise `KeyError` (or behave inconsistently) only in the deferred path, breaking runs that include tool outputs. Consider adding the resolved compaction mode to this context as well so hooks see a consistent shape across both code paths.

Reviews are triggered when you - Open a pull request for review - Mark a draft as ready - Comment "@codex review". If Codex has suggestions, it will comment; otherwise it will react with üëç. Codex can also answer questions or update the PR. Try commenting "@codex address that feedback".
